intro: Gomphia angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved gomphia, is a member of the Restionaceae family, native to South Africa. It is a perennial herb characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and small, clustered inflorescences. The plant typically grows in coastal and sandy habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Its flowering period occurs during the summer months, producing tiny white or pale yellow flowers. Gomphia angustifolia is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions, including salt spray and strong winds.
